meanings.definition: One who assigns or transfers property or rights to another.
meanings.sent1: The assignor signed the document to transfer ownership of the house.
meanings.sent2: The assignor handed over the deed to the new owner.
meanings.sent3: The assignor tried to give away his old toys to his little brother.
meanings.sent4: She was like an assignor of memories, passing on stories from generation to generation.
meanings.sent5: The assignor was like a bridge, connecting the past with the future through property transfers.

meanings.definition: The person who makes an assignment of property or rights to another party.
meanings.sent1: The assignor carefully reviewed the terms before assigning the contract to the buyer.
meanings.sent2: As the assignor, he had the authority to transfer the intellectual property rights.
meanings.sent3: The assignor jokingly pretended to give away his favorite book to his friend.
meanings.sent4: She acted as the assignor of opportunities, opening doors for others to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The assignor was like a key, unlocking new possibilities for the recipient through assignments.
